boardgame.name: Kohle _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Kolonie
boardgame.description: In Kohle _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Kolonie, which is set in the 19th and early 20th centuries, the players run small coal mines in the German Ruhr area (Essen, Hattingen, Bochum, Witten) during the age of industrialization. They need to modernize these mines so that when these smaller mines are merged into larger ones, they can be prepared to take control of the auction and therefore the larger mine. Additionally, players have to ensure the availability of workers for their mines, while also constructing and caring for a railway system that comprises infrastructure in the mines. Finally, if players don't invest money or workers in their mines in order to secure them, they increase their chance of suffering a mining accident, which will lead to negative fallout when it comes time to bid for consolidated mines. Whoever best manages these tasks wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 76 -- A Kiss, A Caress, a Punch in the Face
Episode 83 -- All Ramshackle and Worry Free
Planeta de juegos 15 - Wargames de un día

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

Punched and played once. Carefully bagged and all pieces intact. Local pickup in the DC area can be arranged. FedEx shipping tropically runs between $6-13 in the continental US. Feel free to ask for an estimate or pictures.

Played once. Everything in great condition.
In shrink

Still in shrink. Weight: 2.4 kg I will ship worldwide. DHL shipping rates are as follows: up to 2 kg Germany 4,00 € [max. 60*30*15 cm; + 1,00 € for tracking + insurance up to 500 €] EU 9,00 € [+ 2,00 € for tracking + insurance up to 35 €] worldwide 15,00 € [+ 3,00 € for tracking + insurance up to 35 €] up to 5 kg (tracking + insurance up to 500 € by default) EU 15,00 € non-EU Europe 28,00 € USA, Japan, ... 34,00 € up to 10 kg (tracking + insurance up to 500 € by default) Germany 6,00 € EU 20,00 € non-EU Europe 33,00 € USA, Japan, ... 58,00 € Please use the DHL postage calculator https://www.dhl.de/en.html to get exact rates and round prices up. Delivery at SPIEL in Essen might be possible. Payment by bank transfer (SEPA/IBAN) or paypal. Buyer pays paypal or any other fees. Games on my for trade list are also available. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m always open for negotiations :-)

Please note that shipping costs are not included in the price and have to be added (within Germany it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s approx. 5,00 € for an average-sized game) If you also intend to buy some of my other games I put here on the GeekMarket Shipping costs would be adjusted accordingly (just PM me)

Asmodee (ASMQ050103) In Kohle _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Kolonie, which is set in the 19th and early 20th centuries, the players run small coal mines in the German Ruhr area (Essen, Hattingen, Bochum, Witten) during the age of industrialization. They need to modernize these mines so that when these smaller mines are merged into larger ones, they can be prepared to take control of the auction and therefore the larger mine. Additionally, players have to ensure the availability of workers for their mines, while also constructing and caring for a railway system that comprises infrastructure in the mines. Finally, if players don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t invest money or workers in their mines in order to secure them, they increase their chance of suffering a mining accident, which will lead to negative fallout when it comes time to bid for consolidated mines. Whoever best manages these tasks wins.

Asmodee (ASMQ050103) In Kohle _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Kolonie, which is set in the 19th and early 20th centuries, the players run small coal mines in the German Ruhr area (Essen, Hattingen, Bochum, Witten) during the age of industrialization. They need to modernize these mines so that when these smaller mines are merged into larger ones, they can be prepared to take control of the auction and therefore the larger mine. Additionally, players have to ensure the availability of workers for their mines, while also constructing and caring for a railway system that comprises infrastructure in the mines. Finally, if players don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t invest money or workers in their mines in order to secure them, they increase their chance of suffering a mining accident, which will lead to negative fallout when it comes time to bid for consolidated mines. Whoever best manages these tasks wins.
The Box is light damaged. The other Material is Like New

Whoever best manages these tasks wins.
